title: 'Male, college-aged': FBI briefs on Kirk‚Äôs assassin; what we know about the shooter
content: Authorities are actively searching for the gunman responsible for the fatal shooting of Charlie Kirk, a prominent ally of Donald Trump, during a campus event at Utah Valley University. The attack, which Utah's governor has condemned as a political assassination, prompted a lockdown of the university as investigators scour for evidence. President Trump has vowed to find those responsible for the tragedy.

title: PM to visit Manipur on September 13, will unveil projects worth Rs 8,500 crore
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is scheduled to visit Manipur on September 13, marking his first visit since the ethnic clashes began in May. He will launch development projects worth Rs 8,500 crore, laying foundation stones in Churachandpur, a Kuki-majority area, and inaugurating projects from Imphal.

title: Trump aide killed: Musk calls attack chilling, ‚ÄòShows what we‚Äôre dealing with‚Äô
content: Right-wing activist Charlie Kirk was reportedly shot dead in a targeted attack at Utah Valley University, prompting strong reactions. Elon Musk condemned the act as a "cold-blooded murder," criticizing those celebrating the incident and accusing the left of promoting violence.

title: Gold prices hit all-time high of Rs 1,13,100 per 10g in Delhi, up 43% this year;
content: Gold prices in the national capital reached an all-time high of Rs 1,13,100 per 10 grams, driven by sustained buying and global uncertainties. The precious metal has surged over 40% this year, fueled by central bank activity and geopolitical tensions. Silver prices, however, experienced a slight dip, while investors globally await the US Federal Reserve's policy meeting.

title: Oracle co-founder Larry Ellison edges toward richest-person title once again
content: Oracle's stock experienced a slight dip after a record surge, fueled by its booming AI cloud business. This surge briefly propelled co-founder Larry Ellison past Elon Musk as the world's richest person, with his net worth soaring by nearly $100 billion. OpenAI's massive $300 billion agreement with Oracle for computing power significantly contributed to this growth.

title: Asia Cup: Pak coach makes bold claim ahead of India clash - 'Surface irrelevant'
content: Pakistan team is gearing up for the Asia Cup, with head coach Mike Hesson emphasising the strength of their spin attack, particularly Mohammad Nawaz, ahead of their crucial match against India. Hesson highlighted the depth in Pakistan's spin options, suggesting they could be a defining factor given the UAE's slow pitches.

title: NFL stars mourn Charlie Kirk; Butker leads tributes; Utah death shocks league
content: Conservative activist Charlie Kirk tragically died after being shot at Utah Valley University, sparking widespread reactions. NFL players like Harrison Butker and Jaxson Dart, along with media members, expressed grief and called for an end to political violence. The shocking event united athletes, fans, and media in mourning, highlighting the need for unity and peace.

title: Gemini app tops 10M users: Nano Banana fuels buzz; viral prompts to try
content: Google's Gemini app, featuring the AI image editing tool Nano Banana, has achieved over 10 million downloads shortly after its launch. Users have already created or modified over 200 million images, leveraging Nano Banana's speed and accuracy. Viral trends showcase the tool's versatility, allowing users to transform themselves into action figures, appear in different decades, and step into famous artworks.

title: Deebo Samuel vs Packers: will he play?; Commanders injury update latest
content: Will Washington Commanders wide receiver Deebo Samuel play against the Green Bay Packers tonight? Get the latest injury update, full game details, kickoff time, and streaming info for Thursday Night Football at Lambeau Field. Find out Samuel‚Äôs status, why he‚Äôs key to Jayden Daniels‚Äô offense, and how his trade from the 49ers changed Washington‚Äôs attack.

title: Watch: Haunting moment Charlie Kirk said 'some gun deaths are worth it'
content: At 31, his career ended in the most violent way possible. A sniper‚Äôs bullet struck him in the neck as he spoke to students at Utah Valley University. The rally turned into chaos. Within hours, Kirk was gone.

title: Sachin to be next BCCI Prez? Legendary batter breaks silence: 'We wish to ...'
content: Sachin Tendulkar's management has refuted rumours linking the cricket legend to the BCCI president's position. With the BCCI's AGM approaching on September 28 and the president's post vacant after Roger Binny's exit, speculation had been rampant. However, SRT Sports Management clarified that Tendulkar is not being considered for the role.

title: Charlie Kirk killing: Assassin caught on cam? Shadowy figure seen on rooftop
content: Chilling footage has emerged, purportedly showing the assassin who fatally shot Charlie Kirk at Utah Valley University. The video captures a dark figure on a rooftop moments after the shooting, as chaos erupted among the 3,000 attendees. Authorities are investigating the footage and searching for the rooftop shooter after Kirk was pronounced dead minutes later.

title: Gen Z group, army discuss roadmap for provisional government- Who will be interim PM
content: Following Prime Minister Oli's resignation amid protests, Gen Z protesters are in talks with Nepal's President and Army Chief to form an interim government. Chief Justice Sushila Karki, Kathmandu Mayor Balendra Shah, and others are being considered to lead the caretaker government, tasked with overseeing fresh elections. Discussions continue to navigate the political transition and maintain order.

title: Sonia Gandhi voter roll row: Delhi court dismisses plea seeking action
content: A Delhi court has dismissed a plea seeking action against Congress leader Sonia Gandhi over allegations regarding her inclusion in the electoral rolls before she became an Indian citizen. The complainant, Vikas Tripathi, argued that Gandhi's name was added to the New Delhi constituency's voter list in 1980, prior to her citizenship in 1983.

title: Shah Rukh Khan, Vikrant Massey to attend National Film Awards: Top 5 entertainment news
content: The 71st National Film Awards ceremony in New Delhi is set to honor talents like Shah Rukh Khan and Vikrant Massey. Karisma Kapoor's lawyer dismisses the Rs 30,000 crore estate figure as a 'media creation' amid an inheritance dispute. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan secured a ban on unauthorized use of her name and image.

title: IND vs PAK: Ex-Pakistan captain reveals why buzz is missing ‚Äì 'No hype'
content: Former Pakistan captain Rashid Latif suggested India's easy agreement to play Pakistan in the Asia Cup has diminished the usual excitement surrounding the match. He contrasted this with past encounters where obstacles heightened anticipation, noting high ticket prices as a contributing factor to the subdued build-up. Despite this, he anticipated the match would gain momentum closer to the date.

title: Justin Jefferson‚Äôs chain giveaway: Fan moment goes viral; 'Griddy Boy' regret
content: Justin Jefferson, the Minnesota Vikings' wide receiver, gifted his 'TOP 10' chain to a young fan after defeating the Chicago Bears, sparking heartwarming reactions. While many praised Jefferson's generosity and the unforgettable moment for the child, some fans expressed concerns about the chain's value and the athlete's financial future, highlighting contrasting perspectives on the gesture.

title: Manipur: 43 BJP members quit in Phungyar, days before PM Modi‚Äôs likely visit
content: Ahead of Prime Minister Modi's anticipated visit to Manipur, 43 BJP members in Ukhrul district resigned, citing a lack of inclusiveness and respect for grassroots leadership. This mass resignation occurs against the backdrop of ongoing ethnic tensions between Meitei and Kuki-Zo communities.

title: IND vs PAK tickets: ECB denies sluggish sales; says response encouraging
content: The Emirates Cricket Board (ECB) dismissed reports of sluggish India-Pakistan ticket sales, confirming strong demand. An ECB official said 3,000 Platinum List tickets released online sold out within minutes, underlining the massive fan interest for Sunday‚Äôs high-stakes Dubai clash.

title: MNS warns Kapil Sharma: Mumbai should not be called Bombay or Bambai
content: The Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) has cautioned comedian Kapil Sharma against referring to Mumbai as 'Bombay' or 'Bambai' on his Netflix show, 'The Great Indian Kapil Show.' MNS leader Ameya Khopkar warned of potential strong agitation if the city's name isn't properly addressed.

title: UK PM removes Mandelson as US ambassador over fresh Epstein revelations
content: UK Prime Minister ousted Peter Mandelson as Ambassador to the US after emails revealed a deeper relationship with Jeffrey Epstein. The correspondence suggested Mandelson defended Epstein's initial conviction, a stance undisclosed during his appointment. The sacking followed reports by The Sun and Bloomberg detailing supportive messages sent to Epstein during a 2008 investigation.

title: Vanessa Bryant steps up: fulfills godmother role; sends birthday wishes to Ellie
content: Vanessa Bryant celebrated Pau Gasol's daughter Ellie's 5th birthday with a heartfelt Instagram story, showcasing the enduring bond between the two families. Gasol, touched by the gesture, praised Vanessa as the "Best God Mother!" Their connection, forged during their time with the Lakers, has deepened over the years, with Gasol now a pillar of support for the Bryant family.

title: Dwyane Wade‚Äôs wife Gabrielle Union: craving wild nights; couple sings, grooves
content: Dwyane Wade and Gabrielle Union were spotted enjoying a lively night out with friends, filled with karaoke, singing, and dancing. Union shared glimpses of their fun-filled evening on Instagram, expressing her desire for more such moments. The couple, who recently celebrated their 11th anniversary, were seen attending a football match before heading to the after-party.

title: Karisma legal battle: Lawyer calls Rs 30,000 cr estate claim 'media fabrication'
content: The battle over late Sunjay Kapur's wealth escalates. His children and mother challenge the will. They allege forgery by his widow, Priya Sachdeva Kapur. Sunjay's sister, Mandhira Kapur Smith, supports the children. She questions the will's validity. Karisma Kapoor's lawyer clarifies the focus is on securing the children's inheritance. The family disputes the reported estate value.

title: 200 flyers left sweating on Singapore-bound Air India flight; stranded inside for 2hrs
content: Over 200 passengers on an Air India flight to Singapore faced a distressing ordeal at Delhi airport. Due to malfunctioning air conditioning and electrical systems on Wednesday night, passengers were stuck inside the Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner for nearly two hours. The discomfort led to passengers using newspapers as fans before being deplaned.

title: 'Never understand USA': Faf baffled after Kirk's assassination; 'can have a gun'
content: Political activist Charlie Kirk was fatally shot at Utah Valley University during his comeback tour, prompting a widespread search for the shooter. The incident has sparked reactions, including from Donald Trump, who lamented it as a "dark moment." Ex South Africa skipper Faf du Plessis voiced concerns about American gun laws.

title: 'Multiple active crime scenes': Who killed Charlie Kirk? Police widen search for sniper
content: Charlie Kirk was fatally shot while addressing a crowd at Utah Valley University, prompting an intense manhunt for the rooftop sniper. The conservative activist was answering questions about gun violence when the incident occurred, leading to a campus lockdown. Authorities are actively investigating multiple crime scenes and have questioned, then released, two individuals initially detained.

title: HDFC: Multiple services to be unavailable for several hours on September 13 - check details
content: HDFC Bank will conduct scheduled maintenance on September 13th, 2025, from 12:30 AM to 7:30 AM IST to enhance system performance. During this period, NetBanking, MobileBanking, UPI services, and some ATM/debit card functionalities will be unavailable. Customers are advised to use PayZapp Wallet for uninterrupted payments, while credit card services will remain largely operational.

title: Aishwarya Rai personality rights case: HC orders takedown of unauthorized content featuring actor
content: The Delhi High Court has granted Aishwarya Rai Bachchan interim relief in a case concerning the unauthorized use of her name, image, and persona on digital platforms, including AI-generated content. The court directed platforms, e-commerce sites, and Google to remove infringing content and block specified URLs within 72 hours. Read on.

title: World Athletics C'ships 2025: India‚Äôs full squad and complete schedule in Tokyo
content: India is sending a 19-member squad, spearheaded by javelin star Neeraj Chopra, to the World Athletics Championships in Tokyo from September 13-21. Chopra aims to defend his title, and history will be made with four Indian men competing in the javelin event. Sprinter Animesh Kujur is also set to become the first Indian to participate in the men‚Äôs 200m.

title: 'Vote-chori slogan spreading like fire': Rahul vows 'explosive' proof; slams NDA
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has promised to reveal "dynamic and explosive" evidence of vote theft, alleging the NDA government was formed through stolen votes. He claims to have proof of manipulation, particularly highlighting the "Gujarat model" as a scheme for electoral fraud involving PM Modi, Amit Shah, and the Election Commission.

title: $4 bn P-8I defence deal: US team may come to India; talks amid fresh trade ties push
content: Amidst ongoing India-US trade discussions, a US delegation comprising defence officials and Boeing representatives is expected to visit India next week. They will discuss a $4 billion deal for six P-8I naval patrol aircraft, a deal that had previously stalled.

title: Scientists detect ‚Äògeological heartbeat‚Äô that can split Africa and create a new ocean
content: Beneath eastern Africa, scientists have discovered a dramatic geological process driven by rhythmic pulses of molten rock rising from the Earth's mantle. This "geological heartbeat" weakens the crust, causing earthquakes and volcanic activity. Over millions of years, this process is expected to split Africa into two parts, creating a new ocean basin and reshaping the continent.

title: Pulisic rates 9/10 as win vs. Japan gets USMNT back on track

title: How the NYPD and FDNY honor 9/11 with football, 20 years on
content: cops and firemen heckled each other nonstop from the opening kiwi . they were playing in observance of the 20th anniversary of 9/11 . the two football teams had lost too many people on that day . but they did not put aside their rivalry .

title: Experts' picks and best bet: How can Crawford upset Canelo?
content: if he beats Canelo, he will become the first fighter in men's boxing to unify all four major belts in three divisions . he defeated Caleb Plant by 11th-round TKO in November 2021 to become undisputed champion at 168 pounds . the IBF stripped him for not fighting mandatory challenger William Scull .
